verses.verse: Now <WG3767> when Festus<WG5347> was come into<WG1910> the<WG3588> province,<WG1885> after<WG3326> three<WG5140> days<WG2250> he ascended<WG305> from<WG575> Caesarea<WG2542> to<WG1519> Jerusalem.<WG2414>

Then <WG1161> the<WG3588> high priest<WG749> and<WG2532> the<WG3588> chief<WG4413> of the<WG3588> Jews<WG2453> informed<WG1718> him<WG846> against<WG2596> Paul,<WG3972> and<WG2532> besought<WG3870> him,<WG846>

And desired<WG154> favor<WG5485> against<WG2596> him,<WG846> that<WG3704> he would send for<WG3343> him<WG846> to<WG1519> Jerusalem,<WG2419> laying wait<WG4160> <WG1747> in<WG2596> the<WG3588> way<WG3598> to kill<WG337> him.<WG846>

But <WG3767> <WG3303> Festus<WG5347> answered,<WG611> that Paul<WG3972> should be kept<WG5083> at<WG1722> Caesarea,<WG2542> and<WG1161> that he himself<WG1438> would<WG3195> depart<WG1607> shortly<WG1722> <WG5034> thither.

Let them<WG3588> therefore,<WG3767> said<WG5346> he, which among<WG1722> you<WG5213> are able,<WG1415> go down with<WG4782> me, and accuse<WG2723> this<WG5129> man,<WG435> if there be any<WG1536> <WG2076> wickedness<WG824> in<WG1722> him.<WG846>

And <WG1161> when he had tarried<WG1304> among<WG1722> them<WG846> more<WG4119> than<WG2228> ten<WG1176> days,<WG2250> he went down<WG2597> unto<WG1519> Caesarea;<WG2542> and the<WG3588> next day<WG1887> sitting<WG2523> on<WG1909> the<WG3588> judgment seat<WG968> commanded<WG2753> Paul<WG3972> to be brought.<WG71>

And <WG1161> when he<WG846> was come,<WG3854> the<WG3588> Jews<WG2453> which came down<WG2597> from<WG575> Jerusalem<WG2414> stood round about,<WG4026> and laid<WG5342> many<WG4183> and<WG2532> grievous<WG926> complaints<WG157> against<WG2596> Paul,<WG3972> which<WG3739> they could<WG2480> not<WG3756> prove.<WG584>

While he<WG846> answered for himself,<WG626> Neither<WG3777> against<WG1519> the<WG3588> law<WG3551> of the<WG3588> Jews,<WG2453> neither<WG3777> against<WG1519> the<WG3588> temple,<WG2411> nor<WG3777> yet against<WG1519> Caesar,<WG2541> have I offended<WG264> any thing<WG5100> at all.

But <WG1161> Festus,<WG5347> willing<WG2309> to do<WG2698> the<WG3588> Jews<WG2453> a pleasure,<WG5485> answered<WG611> Paul,<WG3972> and said,<WG2036> Wilt<WG2309> thou go up<WG305> to<WG1519> Jerusalem,<WG2414> and there<WG1563> be judged<WG2919> of<WG4012> these things<WG5130> before<WG1909> me?<WG1700>

Then <WG1161> said<WG2036> Paul,<WG3972> I stand<WG1510> <WG2476> at<WG1909> Caesar's<WG2541> judgment seat,<WG968> where<WG3757> I<WG3165> ought<WG1163> to be judged:<WG2919> to the Jews<WG2453> have I done no wrong,<WG91> <WG3762> as<WG5613> <WG2532> thou<WG4771> very well<WG2573> knowest.<WG1921>

For <WG1063> if<WG1437> I<WG3303> be an offender,<WG91> or<WG2532> have committed<WG4238> any thing<WG5100> worthy<WG514> of death,<WG2288> I refuse<WG3868> not<WG3756> to die:<WG599> but<WG1161> if<WG1487> there be<WG2076> none<WG3762> of these things whereof<WG3739> these<WG3778> accuse<WG2723> me,<WG3450> no man<WG3762> may<WG1410> deliver<WG5483> me<WG3165> unto them.<WG846> I appeal<WG1941> unto Caesar.<WG2541>

<WG1161> Then<WG5119> Festus,<WG5347> when he had conferred<WG4814> with<WG3326> the<WG3588> council,<WG4824> answered,<WG611> Hast thou appealed<WG1941> unto Caesar?<WG2541> unto<WG1909> Caesar<WG2541> shalt thou go.<WG4198>
And <WG1161> after<WG1230> certain<WG5100> days<WG2250> king<WG935> Agrippa<WG67> and<WG2532> Bernice<WG959> came<WG2658> unto<WG1519> Caesarea<WG2542> to salute<WG782> Festus.<WG5347>

And <WG1161> when<WG5613> they had been<WG1304> there<WG1563> many<WG4119> days,<WG2250> Festus<WG5347> declared<WG394> Paul's<WG3972> cause<WG2596> unto the<WG3588> king,<WG935> saying,<WG3004> There is<WG2076> a certain<WG5100> man<WG435> left in bonds<WG2641> <WG1198> by<WG5259> Felix: <WG5344>

About <WG4012> whom,<WG3739> when I<WG3450> was<WG1096> at<WG1519> Jerusalem,<WG2414> the<WG3588> chief priests<WG749> and<WG2532> the<WG3588> elders<WG4245> of the<WG3588> Jews<WG2453> informed<WG1718> me, desiring<WG154> to have judgment<WG1349> against<WG2596> him.<WG846>

To <WG4314> whom<WG3739> I answered,<WG611> It<WG3754> is<WG2076> not<WG3756> the manner<WG1485> of the Romans<WG4514> to deliver<WG5483> any<WG5100> man<WG444> to<WG1519> die,<WG684> before<WG4250> that<WG2228> he which is accused<WG2723> have<WG2192> the<WG3588> accusers<WG2725> face to face,<WG2596> <WG4383> and<WG5037> have license<WG2983> <WG5117> to answer for himself<WG627> concerning<WG4012> the<WG3588> crime laid against him.<WG1462>

Therefore, <WG3767> when they<WG846> were come<WG4905> hither,<WG1759> without any<WG3367> delay<WG311> on the<WG3588> morrow<WG1836> I sat<WG2523> on<WG1909> the<WG3588> judgment seat,<WG968> and commanded<WG2753> the<WG3588> man<WG435> to be brought forth.<WG71>
Against <WG4012> whom<WG3739> when the<WG3588> accusers<WG2725> stood up,<WG2476> they brought<WG2018> none<WG3762> accusation<WG156> of such things<WG3739> as I<WG1473> supposed: <WG5282>

But <WG1161> had<WG2192> certain<WG5100> questions<WG2213> against<WG4314> him<WG846> of<WG4012> their own<WG2398> superstition,<WG1175> and<WG2532> of<WG4012> one<WG5100> Jesus,<WG2424> which was dead,<WG2348> whom<WG3739> Paul<WG3972> affirmed<WG5335> to be alive.<WG2198>

And <WG1161> because I<WG1473> doubted<WG639> of<WG1519> such manner of questions,<WG2214> <WG4012> <WG5127> I asked<WG3004> him whether<WG1487> he would<WG1014> go<WG4198> to<WG1519> Jerusalem,<WG2419> and there<WG2546> be judged<WG2919> of<WG4012> these matters.<WG5130>

But <WG1161> when Paul<WG3972> had appealed<WG1941> to be<WG846> reserved<WG5083> unto<WG1519> the<WG3588> hearing<WG1233> of Augustus,<WG4575> I commanded<WG2753> him<WG846> to be kept<WG5083> till<WG2193> <WG3757> I might send<WG3992> him<WG846> to<WG4314> Caesar.<WG2541>

Then <WG1161> Agrippa<WG67> said<WG5346> unto<WG4314> Festus,<WG5347> I would<WG1014> also<WG2532> hear<WG191> the<WG3588> man<WG444> myself.<WG848> <WG1161> Tomorrow,<WG839> said<WG5346> he,<WG3588> thou shalt hear<WG191> him.<WG846>

And <WG3767> on the<WG3588> morrow,<WG1887> when Agrippa<WG67> was come,<WG2064> and<WG2532> Bernice,<WG959> with<WG3326> great<WG4183> pomp,<WG5325> and<WG2532> was entered<WG1525> into<WG1519> the<WG3588> place of hearing,<WG201> with<WG4862> <WG5037> the<WG3588> chief captains,<WG5506> and<WG2532> principal<WG2596> <WG1851> men<WG435> of<WG5607> the<WG3588> city,<WG4172> at<WG2532> Festus'<WG5347> commandment<WG2753> Paul<WG3972> was brought forth.<WG71>

And <WG2532> Festus<WG5347> said,<WG5346> King<WG935> Agrippa,<WG67> and<WG2532> all<WG3956> men<WG435> which are here present<WG4840> with us,<WG2254> ye see<WG2334> this man,<WG5126> about<WG4012> whom<WG3739> all<WG3956> the<WG3588> multitude<WG4128> of the<WG3588> Jews<WG2453> have dealt<WG1793> with me,<WG3427> both<WG5037> at<WG1722> Jerusalem,<WG2414> and<WG2532> also here,<WG1759> crying<WG1916> that he<WG846> ought<WG1163> not<WG3361> to live<WG2198> any longer.<WG3371>

But <WG1161> when I<WG1473> found<WG2638> that he<WG846> had committed<WG4238> nothing<WG3367> worthy<WG514> of death,<WG2288> and<WG1161> that he<WG5127> himself<WG848> hath<WG2532> appealed<WG1941> to Augustus,<WG4575> I have determined<WG2919> to send<WG3992> him.<WG846>

Of <WG4012> whom<WG3739> I have<WG2192> no<WG3756> certain thing<WG804> <WG5100> to write<WG1125> unto my lord.<WG2962> Wherefore<WG1352> I have brought him forth<WG4254> <WG846> before<WG1909> you,<WG5216> and<WG2532> especially<WG3122> before<WG1909> thee,<WG4675> O king<WG935> Agrippa,<WG67> that,<WG3704> after examination<WG351> had,<WG1096> I might have<WG2192> somewhat<WG5100> to write.<WG1125>

For <WG1063> it seemeth<WG1380> to me<WG3427> unreasonable<WG249> to send<WG3992> a prisoner,<WG1198> and<WG2532> not<WG3361> withal<WG2532> to signify<WG4591> the<WG3588> crimes<WG156> laid against<WG2596> him.<WG846>
